wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
This was another design by Chris Myers Designs for Helen Higgins. Helen required a WordPress site that would allow her to easily upload pictures of her artworks into 'lightbox' galleries.

We utilised the NextGEN gallery WordPress plugin and modified it so that Helen can simply upload a folder of images and everything is automatically resized!

Cannon Hill State School was an unusual project for us because we had to try not to deviate from their previous site design which was somewhat simplistic.

We made sure we were consistent with the Queensland Government Consistent User Experience (CUE) and that the site met accessibility requirements. Cannon Hill State School embrace the creative side of students so we had to create something to match their existing marketing angle even though it was a little different from the normal sennza style.

This was another design by Chris Myers Designs for Narelle Spangher. Narelle required a WordPress site that would allow her to easily upload pictures of her artworks into 'lightbox' galleries.

Narelle didn't want to have to worry about learning how to resize the photos of her artworks so we utilised the NextGEN gallery WordPress plugin and modified it so that Narelle can simply upload a folder of images and everything is automatically resized!

The Nimbin Music Festival website was a charity project and was coded for free by one of our staff over the course of a few hours. Unfortunately the festival had to be cancelled due to a few reasons but it's set to take place next year.

We'll be working with the Nimbin Music Festival again next year to create a new WordPress site and to assist with their social media management.

Albany Creek Gas Fitting & Plumbing required a logo design and WordPress website for their business.

Corey has been able to easily update his website with next to no training from us because WordPress is so simple for clients to use!

Stat Health are a Brisbane based client who reside in the bustling environment at Brisbane Technology Park. Stat Health required a fresh new design that sennza built with WordPress.

The new site now reflects Stat Health's cutting edge medical software and now boosts their reputation online.

Little Bird Nanny Share are a Sydney based client of Chris Myers Designs. Chris designed the website and sennza provided the WordPress theme development.

The sennza team used the Hybrid Theme Framework for this project as the WordPress hooks and actions suited this project. Little Bird Nanny Share also required several forms to collect data from their visitors so we utilised Gravity Forms to collect and track all the data.

Marc Passion Travel is another Sydney based client of Chris Myers Designs. Chris created a fantastic design for this site and sennza turned this design into a WordPress theme.

Marc required a theme that relied heavily upon video posts from YouTube so we made sure to make embedding videos as easy as possible and utilised a few fantastic WordPress features such as oEmbed and the WordPress iPhone application to make blogging on the go as simple as possible!

DIY Designer are a Brisbane client who required a minimalistic and clean WordPress design that would use crisp pastel colours. This project required a few design iterations as we needed to convey an uncluttered but stylish feel that reflects the courses that are provided by Jill and her team.

Once Jill saw the final iteration of the design she actually squealed down the phone to one of the sennza partners so we know we nailed the design for this project!

Moreton Natural Health are another Brisbane based client who required a WordPress design that was 'fresh' for a relatively new procedure called 'colonic irrigation'.

Search engine optimisation (SEO) was vital for this site and within days this site was ranking for 'colonic irrigation brisbane' due to effective on site optimisation.

My Solar Price is a highly customised WordPress install for a Brisbane based company who specialise in solar power quotations. The site streamlines the process for acquiring 3 solar quotations and automatically emails three solar supplies to notify them that a potential customer requires a quotation.

Not only that but the email sends the solar installer highly detailed questions and a Google Maps link that shows the customers roof location!

Stat Health also required a restricted area that was similar to Dell's IdeaStorm.

Once again sennza utilised WordPress as a platform and WordPress user roles to create a site that would allow users to suggest, vote up, vote down and comment on any ideas!

myWheels Driving School are a fantastic driving school in brisbane who came to sennza after they had a few difficulties with other search engine optimisation (SEO) companies.

After a few hours of research and work sennza helped myWheels Driving School climb back to the top of the results and since then we have helped them with Adwords Management, Google Places optimisation, conversion optimisation and also some redesign work.

Hands up for Play is a WordPress based site that sits alongside a Queensland statewide marketing campaign for Childcare Queensland. Hands up for Play has some very unique WordPress features such as a centre locator, and also the parents can upload a picture and a testimonial of their member centre which is automatically added to the site in a 'Pending' state so that the site moderators can review then publish the testimonial with ease.

Mediaris came to us with specific goals in mind, they are very passionate about their customers and like to approach things in a different way to acheive outstanding results. We set out to create a website that stood out from their competition and the normal stock sites in this industry.

Dixon Homes are one of Australia’s largest home building groups. Building over 1000 homes per year throughout Queensland, NSW and Victoria.
Dixon Homes approached is to help with increase their online presence. As part of this Sennza created a news blog using WordPress to help to publish their monthly newsletter online as well as communicate to the public.

The Property Council of Australia come to us to help them design and develop a website where they can display all the events that they hold annually all on one website. They needed it to be easy to update and change as new sponsors or new events started. With the help WordPress custom post types this websites couldn't be more simple to use.

The Gold Coast will be the 3rd city in Australia after Sydney and Melbourne to host a WordCamp, although the Gold Coast is quickly shaping up to the biggest WordCamp in Australia. Sennza, along with Dion Hulse and Brent Shepherd are on the committee to make sure that WordCamp Gold Coast will be a WordPress event to be remembered!

When couriermail.com.au set out to develop their new "Blender" News Blog, their first choice for a CMS was WordPress. The Blender Blog incorporates several custom post types to allow Courier Mail to easily manage and schedule different content areas on their website.

Having worked with Childcare Queensland previously on their Hands up for Play campaign, we were well aware that they were looking to refresh their current website. Although their current website was build in WordPress, they were not happy how hard it was to manage, often having to edit code to achieve what they wanted (not how WordPress was designed to be used). The redesign for CQ focused on bringing extra value to their members through the addition of Members job board as we as members forums to help solidify their Childcare member community.

Star Outdoor specialise in the creation of exciting, professional Outdoor Branding Solutions and practical Sun Protection products. Star Outdoor came to us to redesign and develop their website with a new eCommerce platform

The Edge is an initiative of State Library of Queensland which aims to provide young Queenslanders with the opportunity and inspiration to explore creativity across the arts, technology, science and enterprise. The goal for the Edge website was to take their existing WordPress website and turn this into a turbo charged social network platform to all as much colaboration online as they currently have within The Edge itself.

Registration is now open for the Game Changer Chicago Design Lab's summer transmedia game, The Source. High school students (including incoming freshmen) are encouraged to sign up now to reserve a spot for this 5-week experience that will begin July 8th. The Source will be a part of the Mayor's Chicago Summer of Learning, composed of challenges including investigatory tasks, code-breaking, puzzles, and media production opportunities. Participants will join teams to help our central character, Adia, a 17-year old African American girl living in Chicago, solve problems and to compete against each other for an ultimate prize.
From July 08 to August 16 a 5-week game called The Source will take place across the University of Chicago Campus as part of the Chicago Summer of Learning (CSOL). 25 teams made up of 10 high school youths will meet career professionals to solve the challenges and compete in the game using computers, video, photography and more.
Chicago Summer of Learning (CSOL) CSOL→ is a city-wide initiative to provide Chicago youth with high quality programs exposing them to STEM learning with the goal of sparking an interest in learning that will extend into their school year activities. CSOL is sponsored by Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel’s office in conjunction with a number of partners including: the MacArthur Foundation→, the Mozilla Foundation→, the Hive Learning Network→, Digital Youth Network→, and the University of Chicago’s Ci3→/Game Changer Chicago.

item.dc:creator: bronson
item.content:encoded: So why the name sennza? “Senza” is an Italian word meaning ‘without’ and this word highlights our minimalist approach to the internet. We want to take away the distractions on your website and maximum the sales and leads for your business. Many web designers will add all the latest bells and whistles to your web site but we challenge them to answer a simple question; Are these extras achieving a purpose? If not then you can do without them! It’s logical when you think about it like that isn’t it? Let’s guide your customers to the reasons why they came to your site in the first place. So if that’s the sennza philosophy then you may be thinking: “If you are all about simplicity, then why did you put 2 n’s in your name?” Well let’s just say, you should never be afraid to break the rules! Our aim At sennza, we aim to change your mindset when it comes to web design. Rethink, redesign, results! Every user who visits your site will be there for a purpose. This purpose might be to find your contact details, to find information, to purchase a product or to see a list of…

item.title: Process
item.dc:creator: bronson
item.content:encoded:
Website Strategy

We start by determining what you want your site to achieve. We factor in your goals, current branding, limitations, budget and offer recommendations for your ideal online solution.

Planning

We review your current website content and strip away any unnecessary information to get to the essence of what you want to achieve. We then generate an overview of each page for your site using wireframes (think of them as the building plans for your website). These are used so that you can visualise the layout of your site and you can then communicate any adjustments you may need.

Homepage Design Concept

Using this information, our team will then create two design variations based on your existing branding or logo. If you don’t have a logo, we can create one for you.

Expanded Page Concepts

Once you choose your preferred design, we then create mock ups of each page of your site and finalise the design.

Site Development

This is where your site is coded and the content and photos that you supply are incorporated into your site.

External Testing

After we’ve conducted our own internal testing, we will send you a link to a “staging” site that lets you see the fully functioning site. We then ask you to do your best to “break” the site and to test every feature. If you do happen to find any bugs, then we will fix them before your site goes live.

Final Approval & Going Live

Once you give the final approval to your site, it goes live.

Support

You will fully train you in your site's use, and provide you with detailed online training videos and a manual, covering every aspect of how to use and update your site. This means you always have training when and where you need it.

Ongoing Monitoring

This phase is often missed by web design firms. We will keep an eye on your site and provide you with metrics so you can see how your site is performing. We will also maintain regular back-ups of your site in case of disaster.

item.title: What We Do
item.dc:creator: bronson
item.content:encoded:
What we can do for your business

Sennza builds highly effective websites that are easy to manage and to do that we use on WordPress. Why WordPress? Simply because it is easy for you to update your website and it works! It is also the world's most popular tool for managing your websites content, which means developers around the world are constantly tweaking and improving its functionality.

Specifically, we build websites that:

  • Looks great
  • You can easily update
  • Can be viewed on PCs, tablets and phones
  • Grows as you grow
  • Allows you to integrate your social media strategy
  • Are professional, easy to use and engaging
  • Are future proof!
Give us a call on (07) 3040 1545 an we’ll run over your project with you and give you an idea of pricing for your project. If you’re too lazy to call us then contact us and we’ll call you! We want to make this as easy and hassle free as possible because we’re passionate. (Have a read of Lachlans blog post on “Why we started sennza?”)

How we work with you

  Websites should be as unique as your business. That's why we take the time to understand your business before we create your website. Want to know the details. [column]

WordPress done right

Ensure that you have a website that will continue to work, no matter what you throw at it Every site we build goes through dozens of stringent coding tests, which means no matter where you want to take your site in the future – your site is ready to support it. Want to add in videos? Your site can do it. Want to add in forums or blogs in the future. Your site can do that too! Want to change your look or refresh your brand in years to come? You can keep your current content and the website foundations and you can have a total new website look without the hassles of transferring your data. This feature alone will save you thousands in development costs and countless hours of time. [/column] [column]

Custom-made design

Great design builds trust, what does your website say about your brand? Here at Sennza, we custom design your website so that it is 100% unique in terms of design – you are not getting a run of the mill template, but something tailor-made that matches the look and feel of your brand, and that reflects the needs of your customers. We take the time to understand what important to your business. [/column]

Here's what our clients say about us…

Throughout the process of redeveloping The Edge website the team took the time to understand the brief and all the complexities it entailed and consistently went above and beyond to deliver a high quality product. Time and time again they demonstrated their ingenuity and their passion for the WordPress platform and their commitment to the open, sharing nature of the WordPress community. It was a pleasure to work with the Senza team. Rebekah Waite – Queensland State Library, The Edge

item.title: Responsive Design
item.dc:creator: bronson
item.content:encoded:
Tablet sales will surpass desktops this year alone (IDC), and it’s estimated that there will be 10 billion mobile connected devices by 2016 (Cisco). - Peter Levine
Having a website that is designed responsively means having a website that will work in all modern browsers, inluding all modern mobile and tablet devices! The problem with creating a dedicated mobile website is that you have to manage your website content twice. Responsive design solves this problem be resizing and reshaping your website to fit the size of the browser it is being viewed in. Other reasons you would want your website to be responsive include:
  • User Experience (UX): Website adjusts to any screen size, making it a good long-term solution to UX with the current plethora of devices (including mobile/tablet hybrids).
  • Cheaper than developing a dedicated mobile app.
  • Don't need to develop/maintain different code bases for iPhone vs Android vs iPad, etc
  • Site will work on future devices that are yet to be invented or produced. Provided the future devices come with a modern browser it will work.
  • Manage content from one place 'write once. publish everywhere'
  • Better for SEO - Responsive websites is Google preferred method for mobile vs dedicated mobile websites.
  • Faster - Mobiles have slower connection speeds than desktops. Responsive design site can serve optimised images based on the devices its being viewed from.
  To find out if your website is responsive you can go here and enter your website URL

item.title: WordPress Website Design
item.dc:creator: bronson
item.content:encoded:
What we can do for your business

Standalone Websites

We can create a unique website based around your logo and offline branding that is easy to use, has a stunning design and (most importantly) will generate leads and enquiries! Not only that, there are many benefits for your business using our preferred content management system (CMS):
  • It’s easy to use and update
  • WordPress is the most popular CMS
  • It’s secure!
  • It’s easy to redesign!
  • It’s got blogging built in!
  • We’re experts at it!
  [column]

eCommerce

Have you got an existing product that you’d like to sell securely online? Cool! We want to make your eCommerce site for you and get you selling your products as quickly as possible. Not only that, we want to make purchasing so easy and secure that your customers will be satisfied and will never get confused! But I’ve got an existing eCommerce site already but it’s not performing as much as we’d hoped. We’ll tell you how a redesign, tweaking and testing will help boost your sales. You might need to be ranking higher in Google’s search results, you might need clearer calls to action (using colourful buttons, action words and different imagery to guide customers around your site) or you might have in roadblocks that make it too hard and painful for customers to get to your checkout. [/column] [column]

Custom coding

But my company needs someone to develop a completely new web application for our business. Awesome! That’s the stuff that gets Bronson (one of our web developers with over 10 years experience) extremely excited. He’ll be fleshing out wireframes, database tables, forms and functions in no time! We’ll create a unique online solution that is easy to use and easy to update! For a custom coding project we’ll send out a couple of our team members to give you a free consultation to gather the requirements, give you fresh ideas and get back to you with a proposal within a few days. [/column]

Oh yeah, we didn’t mention that we’re transparent too did we?

If you choose us for your website project we’ll give you a username and password to log into our project management system so you can see the to-do lists, tasks and milestones during the project. Not only that, you can add comments and feedback to tasks as they happen! We want you to know everything that is going on. We won’t leave you in the dark!

item.title: WordPress Meetups
item.dc:creator: bronson
item.content:encoded:
We run the WordPress Meetups in Brisbane and Sydney

At sennza we live and breathe all things WordPress. We love the software and because it's an open source product we believe it's out duty to give back to the open source community. We do this by providing our time and knowledge completely free of charge to educate people in Brisbane and Sydney about WordPress. We do this by hosting the WordPress Brisbane and WordPress Sydney Meetups.

What you'll get from our Meetups:

  1. Short talks on WordPress and how to use it effectively
  2. Live WordPress demonstrations
  3. Guest speakers! (because everyone uses WordPress differently)
  4. Q & A (because sharing knowledge is key)
  5. Networking (Meet people WordPress newbies and experts!)
  6. Free stuff! (We give away door prizes!)
  7. Fun....seriously, you'll meet great people, have fun and get to have a beer with them afterwards!
Why not pop along to the next Meetup? It's free so you have nothing to lose and lots to learn! :)

item.title: Maintenance Plan
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded:
WordPress Core Updates:

The number 1 reason for a WordPress website being hacked is due to running out of date and vulnerable software. The development team for WordPress will be increasing their release cycles from 2 - 3 per year to 4 - 5, with this increase is is not sustainable

WordPress Plugin Updates:

On average we use 20 plugin on a WordPress website. Just like WordPress, these plugins receive updates for vulnerabilities or features and need to be updated. Not just a matter of clicking update, we check and test these plugins when there is an update before we install this on your website. In some cases making sure we wait for a stable version before we upgrade.

Paid Plugin Updates:

At Sennza we believe in using the very best software for your website. The best often involves paying for premium plugins rather than using a free but substandard plugin. Premium plugins often require annual licences for future updates, on this maintenance plan we will ensure you get all future updates without having to manage dozens of licences

Daily Remote Backup :

Some hosting companies will create backs up for you, but having your host save your backups for you is no good when you host goes down you have no access to these backups.

 

Emergency Backup Restore:

Things don’t often go wrong but when the do you need someone to act quickly. On this maintenance plan you will get up to 2 emergency

item.title: resourcefulness vs resources
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded: What holding you back from your business ideas? In business we have to make decision daily about what we will do, how we can serve our customers better, how we can out do our competition What do all these have in common? They are all resources. The defining factor is normally not resources’ but resourcefulness. The ultimately resource is emotion reason for failing to achieve - money, time, information (claim to missing resources) lack of resourcefulness not resources When people fail to achieve their goals, what are the reasons they usually give? Most of the time people will claim lack of resources, time, money, skills Resources vs Resourcefulness Time vs Creativity (time is the one thing in the world that everyone has the same of, no matter where you are) (gary vee? come home and work some more?) Money vs Determination (Andrew Warner J Crew Story) (http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/06_33/b3997001.htm how digg started with $1000) Technology vs Love/Energy what technologies have been better but failed? Contacts vs Curiosity (ask and you shall receive) examples??? Experience vs Passion (virgin- Taking on emi?) (Mark Cuban story? RTFM) Management vs Resolve The digg story - paying some one Link to Tony Robbins Talk http://www.ted.com/talks/lang/eng/tony_robbins_asks_why_we_do_what_we_do.html Work in progress - if you can think of any examples for the above let be know :)

item.title: 5 Ways Small Businesses Can Use Tech to Save Money

item.title: Facebook Just Solved Drew Barrymore's Problem
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded:
Communication made simpler.

So today facebook released a not-so-email service with a massive re-vamp of their Facebook messages system. Ok, now for those of you that haven’t seen the movie and have no idea what I’m talking about, surely none.... (joke) There is a scene in the movie ‘She Just Not That Into You’ where Drew Barrymore is overwhelmed by all the different ways that she needs to communicate just to have a relationship. Voicemail, phone, text, blackberry email etc... just see below... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tVlqVHKn2dg#t=02m11s People are overwhelmed with all the different ways that are available to keep in touch. Facebook is trying to make this simpler with one central hub. There are so many companies trying to solve the email problem. Google released priority inbox recently and dozens of clones have followed. Facebook takes a top level view of this problem, where email is just one small piece of the way we all communicate on a daily basis. So is the new facebook messages an email killer? No, definitely not. Will it make it easier to communicate with people close to you? ... I think so. Right now, Facebook messages is merging four main ways to communicate: SMS, IM, email, and Facebook messages. All these things on their own are huge markets, but if Facebook can convince people to merge even 2 of these together this will be one massive platform. On a side note: Facebook's social graph will now get to add external emails and phone number.... very smart Mr Zuckerberg.

2011 is set to be an amazing year!

At Sennza, we care greatly about all of our customers and want to help you grow your business in 2011! Google recently did a survey late last year and asked, “What is your biggest wish for 2011?” The results are in and it seem the message is clear: The top 2 wishes for business owners were:
  1. Move my Business Online.
  2. Grow my Business.
And one of the quickest and cost effective ways to grow your business is with Search Engine Optimisation

Search Engine Optimisation or SEO.

Quite simply SEO is the process of optimising your website so that is will rank higher in search engines such as Google. The higher you rank the more people will find you. Did you know that 56% of people click on the 1st result in Google, but this drops off to only 13% for the second result. As you can see from the chart below, the higher you are in the results the more exponential the customers you will get visiting you website. SEO is one of the most cost effective ways to promote your business and increase your customers. For example: The costs for SEO are minute when compared to the cost of listings in the Yellow Pages! An ad the size of business card can cost over $6000 in Yellow Pages print directory. Not only this but you have no way to actually measure the how many people see your ad!

item.title: Backup are Restore: The Autopsy
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded: "The thing about backups isn't if you'll need them, but when you'll need them." The is not the kind of post that anyone like to have to write, and if you have every experienced this yourself you know its some thing that you cringe at when you read this. The was we doing work for a fairly highly trafficed site. As usual before we do any major work on clients sites we complete a full back up of their website. Why it happened, This client was not on our hosting and was using their own hosting on Bluehost. Luckily in this case Blue has had a backup that was only 1 day old. We did the full restore, and wiped the sweat from our brow. A bit about Sennza back up process: I remember reading about the Backup 321 rule and this has served us well to date. Backup 321 states that you should have: 3 copies of the original On 2 different formats. ie DVD and Hard Drive With 1 copy offsite. With every Website we do, we have the original stored offine on a multi layered storage array In addition to that it it obviously stored online of the server. And for the majority of our sites we also have weekly backup to a remote AWS setup with Amazon. This lesson really tought me that in theory the client is responsible for the backup for their website, but in practive it is always the webdeveloper responsibility. Utimately is something goes wrong we know that it comes down to us having to fix this. For anyone that relies on their website for their business and their income $15/ month(beta) means absolutely nothing to you when faced with a website being down. I won't even mention the sum of money I would have been prepared to pay to get this problem fixed. The first thing that I did when we got the website fully restored was install VaultPress and start the backup process. Once you activate your golden ticket for VaultPress you are sent a receipt with a conformation email. Towards the bottom of the email is the line: "And rest easy. The VaultPress Safekeepers are now on your side." After today, I can't tell you just how glad I was to read that line. So in advance I'd like to send a big thank you out to Brian, Demitrious, John, Matt, MT, & Paul.

item.title: Maxitec Group
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded:
Would you mind giving a brief description about what Maxitec Group does and your role there?

Maxitec’s core business is focused on providing the very latest in machine technology and fabrication systems to Australian sheet metal manufacturers. Moving from 2011 into 2012 we saw the need to really innovate our brand and company, to position ourselves towards becoming the leading expert in our field representing only the best brands and systems that could aid in turning manufacturing around in this country.  

With your previous website, how many hours would you spend updating or maintaining your website during the week?

One of the biggest challenges we faced was with having an adequate and effective presence through our website. Initially, like many companies at the time, we used standard html format websites often created in-house by myself. Whilst this was an easy proposition during the early 90’s, the constant development in this area of the internet meant that unless you had the time to stay abreast of the fast changing developments and learn the latest scripting and flash tools, our website was rarely updated and became very dated very fast. In the last few years we looked at a ‘cms’ style web page which was offered by an IT company and we jumped on the opportunity as we felt this would allow us to forget about the page formatting and simply focus on an easy way to add new content on a regular basis. Unfortunately the system was ‘clunky’ and the templates used looked a little amateurish. Further to this, the ability to copy and paste from other sources caused nightmares for getting consistent formatting. At the end of 2011 after some investigation I stumbled upon the ability to use WordPress to be the backbone of our total web site and then engaged Sennza to build us a web site to suit our new image and growth plans. Sennza created some fantastic template designs that really captured the essence and feel of what i wanted to achieve for Maxitec.

This is your first time you have ever used WordPress for a website. How did you find the learning curve? Is there anything that surprised you when you first started using WordPress to edit you website?

The learning curve for WordPress was so simple, and adding content to the site takes only a few minutes. The ease at which i can change content, reassigned pages to new menu groups meant i needed no experience whatsoever in web design. Furthermore the formatting issues that plagued our previous CMS attempts did not exist due to the structure of the template design and in-built adherence to an overall theme. Our site incorporates product information as well as news items and case studies and has the inbuilt ability to send out all our news articles via an RSS feed. Just recently i discovered the power of combining the RSS feed out of our site into an email marketing system (such as MailChimp) to automatically turn all new news content into a pre-formatted newsletter which gets emailed out to our subscribers on a regular basis without the need for any additional work or interaction by myself. This in itself has saved me hours of work and headaches! During the course of 2012 we plan to continue our company growth plans and as part of this process we will be engaging with Sennza to add a “customer portal” and online sales process to our site. Moving to a well created WordPress based site was the best step we ever took for our company in terms of web-based marketing. The traffic levels through our site rose dramatically since its new inception and the average page views and average time on site also rose dramatically as measured through google analytics.

Before:

 

After:

item.title: Website In A Day
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded:
Website In A Day: Create Your Small Business Website in Just 1 Day

You’ve had your website for your business for a while now. It was great at the time, but it is starting to look a bit dated.  You want to revamp your site to make it more modern, but having an experienced designer create one from scratch is a serious investment for most small businesses. What if you could have tap into the expertise of one of the top web design companies in Brisbane, while cutting the cost of getting a revamped website? At Sennza we have a passion for helping small businesses succeed. And we know that not everyone has the budget for a fully tailored solution. So we decided to do things a bit differently.

Enter: The Website In A Day

When you are in small business, you don’t have time for mucking around. That’s why we are running a one-day workshop to help you revamp your existing small business website in the most budget friendly way and in the shortest time possible.

What does that mean exactly?

Simple! At the end of the day’s session you will walk away with a fully functional, ready-to-rock revised website for your business.  Now this website is not going to be a standard, boilerplate, off-the-shelf website that looks the same as thousands of other websites out there. You are going to be designing your site using a special “designed by Sennza” WordPress theme.  We have been working really hard over the last 6 months to come up with a really special theme just for small businesses. Our theme uses the latest tested design theory to ensure your website looks professional and trustworthy. This theme is currently only available to Sennza clients, and is fully customisable with your colours, designs and fonts.

In other words – your site will be unique to your business.

And your website is designed to be super simple to use, update and amend, as well as being built to be SEO (Search Engine Optimisation) friendly and also withstand hacker attacks. We understand that we will be covering a lot of content in just one day. That’s why after the day, you will leave the workshop with a stack of pre-recorded videos and a written manual to refresh your memory on how to update your new website in the future. And of course, you will have the tools, skill and confidence to tackle what you want to do with your website.  

So, specifically what will be covered?

In this workshop, we will be covering a mountain of information including:

  • Providing you with a fully functional website you can walk away with
  • The essentials of a trustworthy website – what separates a great website from a bad website
  • Different types of web pages - including blogs posts, pages and landing pages.
  • Page layout and colours
  • Starting and organising website
  • How to save, view and publish your web pages
  • Adding and adjusting images – banners, images and videos
  • How to manage your website content so that it is fresh, compelling and gets results
  • Links, anchors and image links
  • Adding in forms to capture customer details
  • How to stop hackers before it's too late
  • How to attract more business through your business website
  • Monitoring traffic to your site
Plus A beginners guide to SEO – what it is, and 3 simple tweaks you can do to you site for better results (we won’t guarantee you will be an SEO ninja at the end of the workshop – but you will have a better idea of what you need to do get better rankings)

Who can attend?

To help ensure you get the results you are looking for, our Website Website In A Day workshop is designed for a maximum of 10 hands-on small business participants, who are keen to learn the steps to possess a website that will blow your competition out of the water. You don’t need to know complex code, or even have had any experience building a website. We have designed our Website Website In A Day  workshop to teach you what you need to learn, using simple easy-to-follow tools. 

If you have used Microsoft Word and a web browser before – you can do this workshop!

You also get 2 expert mentors for the day, not 1. This means you will be able to maximise your dedicated 1-on-1 sessions throughout the day. Just bring your laptop and a willingness to give things a go.  

So what’s the catch?

Of course there a few provisos when running a one day workshop. Think of any cooking show on TV. You will notice that when the chef prepares a great dish that all of the ingredients are chopped and measured ready for inclusion before the cameras roll. Before Website Website In A Day, Sennza will walk you through your website ingredient list – helping you to prepare everything that you need before you walk into the room, no more than a few hours of your time. It all starts with an initial pre-planning phone call, where you are talked through exactly what you need. This will be followed up by a checklist, to help you tick off your ingredients as you collect them. Just send the images, text, keywords and other goodies on your recipe list through to Sennza before the workshop, and we will double-check to make sure you have everything you need. That’s it really. If you have everything prepared, you will walk away with a revamped website at the end of the day. We have designed the costs of Website In A Day to be fully inclusive on the day, with your template yours to keep and use at no additional charge. However, if you would like us to organise a new domain name, hosting, emails or additional tailoring of your template, we can organise that for you at our regular rates.

When is Website Website In A Day?

Website Website In A Day is on 17th July

  Where: Salt House: 888 Brunswick St, New Farm, Queensland. When: 17th July Bring: Your laptop and enthusiasm :) How much: $880 inc GST which includes a delicious lunch and bottomless coffee and tea. Parking free

Remember, this workshop is limited to 5 people maximum – so you need to book quickly to guarantee your place.

 

Still Have Questions?

We understand you may have some questions about the workshop. Feel free to call us or drop us a line and we will answer them for you.

Here’s a few we have already received:

I wouldn't have the first clue about building a website! What experience do I need? The simple answer is very little; this workshop is designed for beginners and novices. Provided you have used Microsoft Word and a web browser, you will be fine! But can't I get a website built cheaper than this? Let’s be honest - how many people brag they have bought the cheapest car on the road? Cheap sites are cheap for a reason – they are not the same quality. Plus remember, this workshop is teaching you how to manage your own website so you are not stuck forking out fees to a web developer for every tiny change. I use a Mac/PC? Is that OK? Yes. Website Website In A Day (and the template) is fine for both Macs & Windows. Hang on! I've bought a website from you before. Are these people getting a better deal than I did? If you are one of our current clients, you have a totally tailored design website and not a template based site. And we took all the hard work out of your website for you – doing all the hard yards in terms of design and layout, just handing you the keys to a fully functional site when we were done.  You also have had loads of one on one contact and training with us in your site design.  Think of it like any renovation project. You can DIY and save a few dollars or you can hire an expert to do it for you and save on time, while guaranteeing a great result. Of course, if you would like a refresher on any of the training content, just let us know.  

Remember, the Website In A Day is only $880 (inc GST)

This is the first time we have offered this program, and based on our conversation with clients we expect Website In A Day to fill fast!  
 
PS: We are also offering a 100% money back guarantee. If you are not happy with the Website Website In A Day, then we will refund your money in full!

Book now – the only risk is that you will create a brilliant new website for your business.

item.title: Introduction to WordPress - Brisbane

WordPress today is what Microsoft Word and Photoshop were to the businesses of yesterday. With more than 25% of all websites in the world built upon WordPress, businesses and college students are desperate to learn how WordPress works, and how to improve their WordPress website—as well as how to get out on the social Web with WordPress. * WordPress has become the platform of choice for millions of sites worldwide. WordPress is a content management system deployed in sophisticated environments from eCommerce to travel to galleries and much more. But for all it's power, the appeal of WordPress is in its simplicity and ease of use, demanding very little of the web newbie while allowing those with more savvy to take it to new heights. This course assumes little prior knowledge of the web, taking you through the steps of downloading the installation files, deploying them to a host, setting up a database, choosing a theme, and getting underway with posting and publishing. It's a great introduction to the topic regardless of your requirements.Are you a small business that uses WordPress for your website?Do you work for a company that uses WordPess? Choosing a theme Extending WordPress: The top plugins we use on every website WordPress and Mobile phones. SEO masterclass - How to get your website seen by thousands! (Worth the price of the course alone) At the end of the day you will: Be a master of WordPress Understand how to navigate the WordPress dashboard Know which plugins are the best to use and how to find through ones

Why Us?

Sennza spend al day, every day using, designing and developing for WordPress, we have worked with 100's of companies to ensure that understand and use WordPress to it's full potential. You should expect someone to train you with any less experience! We use WordPress everyday, we live and breathe it Real Life experience with major Australian companies: See portfolio.

item.title: Why We Started Sennza
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded: For me personally, technology is something I’ve been passionate about since I was teenager. This all started when I first heard the digital buzz of a 14.4kbs modem connecting to the internet, way back in the days when you had to choose between being able to use the telephone or connecting to the internet, but never both. Image Credit Link   I’ve been watching the web change and evolve over the years as we increased our processor speeds and developed lighting fast internet connections. Some of the changes I’ve seen and others I’m not so passionate about. In the last five years I kept arriving at websites and not being able to find the information or products was very frustrating for me as an end user. I saw the potential to make a change to these sites and decided that I would find some like minded thinkers and form a business based around our ideas. Our goal is two fold: I see a lot of ugly websites on the internet today, cluttered and unusable, and as someone who spends an unnatural amount of time on the internet this affects me greatly. There are so many SME websites that just don’t represent the company and what they stand for. More often than not their website is left unattended and left for dead, and in a world where a customer’s research methods for finding what they want have been whittled down to a Google search and a few mouse clicks. You need to make sure that your website gets the attention it requires and in return you will end up with increased leads and sales. Our first goal is to work with you to rethink, redesign and get results. The internet does much more than just let us find information and view pretty pictures, it has allowed us to become more efficient. Both with our time and resources. This wasn’t always the case, and it still isn’t in many cases. In my previous roles I have had the opportunity to talk with thousands of small business owners across Australia. So I like to think I have a good understanding of the constraints that most businesses face. Often the sales, marketing and finance departments of small companies are a one man band to begin with, and even as these companies grow, the recent economic recession has given us a swift reminder that we always need to be looking for ways to do more with less. There many ways that the internet can help us automate our business processes. This is where our second goal comes into play, we are here to help many businesses use technology as a helper, not a hindrance. So through combining simplicity in design with ROI for businesses we hope to show that web designers can do more than make your website look beautiful and functional but actually help to improve and grow your business!

item.title: 2011: The Year The Internet Could Not Be Ignored
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded:
The Bubble Is Back.

All throughout 2011, you couldn’t read tech related blog without people comparing it to the tech bubble of ‘99. People would continually ask, are we in another bubble? with very smart people arguing for and against the bubble. But there was good reason, 2011 saw a huge growth in the “angel investment” for tech companies with masses of small startups receiving seed investments. The startup Color was notable company whose investment of $40mil turned a lot of heads. On the other side of the scale we started to see the return of the tech IPO with heavy hitters like Linkedin, Zynga and Groupon finally seeing pay day through listing on the stock exchange  

 Government See Internet As A Threat.

On January 26 2011, during the the height of civil unrest within the Egypt, the government shut down all cell phone and internet access in what they claim was an attempt to control the riots that were getting out of control. Then on February 21 in Libya, Gaddafi followed suit and shut down internet access for all of Libya. Groups of protestors were using Facebook and Twitter to communicate organise areas to meet and rally in protest. Clearly the internet has come along way if Dictatorships are finally taking notice of it's power.  

Bricks And Mortar Gives Way To Online.

The battle of the bricks and mortar retails vs the online retails has been going since the day that amazon.com first launched in 1999, and after being label everything from amazon.bomb to amazon.toast, they ecommerce giant finally won the battle. On February 16, 2011, Borders applied for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection after years of ignoring the online space. It took Borders a ful 15 years between the launch of amazon.com to open an eBook store that allowed books to be directly downloaded to an e-reader device. Clearly 15 years too late. For Borders, ignoring the internet for as long as that did it was clear that this was not a game they could play catch up with.  

Hacking Becomes Mainstream.

The group known as anonymous in brought to the publics attention. Anonymus - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-11935539 The goup of hackers that call themselves ‘Anonymus’ hit the news big time in 2011. Clocking up a total of 5 different large scales arrests. Notable hacker attacks included, wiki leaks, the playstation store attack, paypal, mastercard and visa websites (wikipedia)  

Our Online Rights Are Threatened.

The movie and music industry resort to lobbying the government. Sopa &Pipa – The future of the internet was greatly threatened for all towards the end of 2011 with a thankfully narrow miss. If the SOPA and PIPA acts had been passed. These acts are the online equivalent of say that a car manufacture is responsible and liable is someone uses their car to rob a bank. Wikipedia shuts down in a blackout as protest against the 2 acts.

In sports, you know who your opponents are. You know when you are going to play a game. You know pretty much how long the game will last. It’s mentally and physically exhausting if you are at the top of the game, but it still pails at the effort required to be successful in business.
The sport of business isn’t divided into games. It’s not defined by practices. It doesn’t have set rules that everyone plays by.
The sport of business is the ultimate competition. It’s 7x24x365xforever.
Do yourself a favour and by this book, it stands pup against any of the other billionair biographies out there.

item.title: Why you should never user Captcha, ever
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded:
Every one has experienced the joy of trying to figure out exactly what the tiny distorted letter on a web form say, only to find out that what the the letters said is not evern close to what they had typed.
So why do they even exist? To put it simply, the field is to try, and I emphisise try, to prove that the person entering the form is a human and not so automatic spam bot that trawls the internet filling out forms with malicious links for you to click on.
At a recent meeting for a website redesign project, I proclaimed that "I'm a human and even I have trouble reading them" even single person in the room agree.
So if the job for Captcha is to prove you are a human filling out this form and most humans can read this maybe we need to look at this situation instead of blindly adding this field to ever form we develop.
In fact, recently 3 hackers unviled a system that coud beat reCaptcha with 99% accuracy http://arstechnica.com/security/2012/05/google-recaptcha-brought-to-its-knees/
Google revamped its reCAPTCHA system, used to block automated scripts from abusing its online services, just hours before a trio of hackers unveiled a free system that defeats the widely used challenge-response tests with more than 99 percent accuracy.
Hang on... so now "non-humans" can type these things out better than humans? Ok, surely there has to be a better solution that this? after all Captcha has been around since 2000 - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CAPTCHA
 
At Sennza, we use something called a anti-spam honey pot field, this is an field that is invisible to a human, but not to an automatic form filling robot. Therefore it's safe to assume that any forms that come though with the invisible field filled out was submitted by a robot.
Honey pot field - Gravity forms, a WordPress plugin makes this really easy to implement.
But you can also make this fun,
 
http://theroxor.com/2011/10/28/creative-captcha/ - Creative and fun captchas
Also,
http://www.oddee.com/item_96665.aspx - abusive captchas

item.title: What is is "best practice" for mobile web design?
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded:
Recently I had the privilege of seeing a presentation for another design agency, and 1 of the slides stood out to me. The slide was labeled "Mobile best Practice" Which lead me to question, what is the mobile best practice, if indeed there is sun a thing? Listed below are the screenshots of example websites they used to present "best practice" for mobile website design [gallery link="file" columns="2"]   All are nice websites from corporate websites, so I can see how it would be easy to confuse "best practice" with "let's look at what the big guys are doing" All examples that were used were dedicated mobile websites. ie. m.website.com. The trouble with that is each of these sites has a very specific purpose, it provides a completely disjointed experience for a visitor that has previously visited their desktop website. ie. displaying banking information, or they have a large dedicated team behind them. For Sennza we have the opinion that responsive design should very much be the "best practice" way to do mobile. So what is responsive design? It's not a surprise that many agencies do not know how to design for a responsive website. The term Responsive design was only really coined a few years ago. The article that is reagarded as being the first to really coin the phrase "responsive design" was by Ethan Marcotte on A List Apart. The foundations of responsive design such as flexible width and media queries have been around for a long time, but Ethan was the one that put them together. Res
  • User Experience (UX): Website adjusts to any screen size, making it a good long-term solution to UX with the current plethora of devices (including mobile/tablet hybrids). Hiding elements which aren't crucial for mobile visitors helps to achieve their goals faster.
  • Cheaper than developing a dedicated mobile app.
  • Don't need to develop/maintain different code bases for iPhone vs Android vs iPad, etc
  • Site will work on future devices that are yet to be invented or produced. Provided the future devices come with a modern browser it will work.
  • Manage content from one place 'write once. publish everywhere'
  • Better for SEO - Responsive websites are Google preferred method for mobile vs dedicated mobile websites.
  • Faster - Mobiles have slower connection speeds than desktops. Responsive design site can serve optimised images based on the devices its being viewed from.

item.title: Goodbye IE7 & 8
item.dc:creator: lachlan
item.content:encoded:
A strange pattern for has been occurring over the last 12 month. Whenever we present a website to a client for review. The very first piece of feedback that we get is always related to a the website on an iPad or a mobile phone. For at least the last 12 months we have been providing responsive design as the minimum for any website development, not an upsell or a value add but as a minimum, because that's what we believe a the minimum for a website should be.
As of today, Sennza will no longer be developing website that compadible with Internet Explorer 7 as part of our standard browser testing.
For some background,
IE7 was released by Microsoft in October 2006 - 6 years ago, WordPress was only 3yrs old - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Explorer_7
IE8 was released in March 2009 - so if you have bought a computer in the last 3 years you won't have IE7. Considering the average lifespan of a computer is 3 - 5 years.
 
Why has IE8 lingered so long? 2 letter XP. Microsoft has already announced 'End of Life' for XP as of ... which means they will no longer support it. I think it's safe to say that if the company that build the product no longer supports it's own product, the web developers can stand up and have some respect for moving the web forward instead of holding it back.
This is certainly not a bold move but it is one that we wanted to make. There are many other web services that have dropped support for IE7 already:
Facebook doesn't support it - link
Google Apps doesn't support it
WordPress dashboard - still supported but not for long - http://browsehappy.com/ - Isn't it just a tab ironic that that we are trying to optimise WordPress website for browsers that WordPress itself *doesn't support?*
css3 border radius - http://html5readiness.com/
Bootstrap, a popular web framework has dropped support for ie7 in version 3.0
Analytics for non tech savvy sites show - (Mystic total 159,823 IE7 - 3,256 2% IE6 - 327 0.2%) (Dixon total 35,752 IE7 - 1,299 3.6% IE6 - 220 0.6%) (D3 total 12,618 4.6% IE7 - 585 IE6 - 89 0.7%) WordPress.com stats from Dion?
http://www.kogan.com/au/blog/new-internet-explorer-7-tax/
But so far this posts only talks about the negative, and why we don't feel IE7 & 8 are worth our time or our clients expense. The reality is that with the website we deal with mobile and table views for site we deal with range from a min of 20% up to 45% of all website visits. We want to help our clients look to the future of their business, not dwell in the past.
So, after all this, does that mean that Sennza won't optimise for Internet Explorer? No it doesn't. It just means that we will no longer do it by default
 
 
Other Stats:
http://www.w3schools.com/browsers/browsers_explorer.asp
http://html5readiness.com/
Also this:
https://twitter.com/sennza/status/385242934083219458

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
IE8 usage is now at 4.7% of the web, we have to wonder what percentage of this is actually web devs checking browser compatibility? ;)

— sennza (@sennza) October 2, 2013

item.title: Taking Online Thinking Offline
item.dc:creator: bronson
item.content:encoded:
I was going about my daily morning wake routine, which generally starts with a few barely audible groans as I wake up and use gravity to roll out of bed and stumble over to put the kettle on while I rub the sleep out of my eyes and attempt to recollect the evenings dreams. (I should mention that unfortunately, not enough of those dreams involve scantily clad Swedish vixens having pillow fights). After I’ve made my coffee I usually fire up the computer to read my RSS feeds in Google Reader, then see what inane ramblings my friends on the other side of the world have made on the “Zuckerberg Platform of World Domination”…err, I mean Facebook. This morning one of my mates had a status update about her “managing to assemble some IKEA furniture after several hours” and it got me thinking. Image Credit Link   I have to admit, I’ve never EVER had any problems assembling any furniture from IKEA…a.k.a. “the flat-packed warehouse of dreams”! However, I have watched a couple of my ex-girlfriends struggle with the task even though they would all attempt to follow the instructions. As a male, I stick to the “if all else fails, read the instructions” rule that my father passed down to me and no doubt his father passed down to him as well. Anyways, in my briefing musing, I wondered why IKEA hasn’t taken an online support angle to their products. These days most web applications have a knowledge-base containing videos that are short and engaging. In a world where nobody seems to RTFM and every consumer has a DVD player then why don’t companies like IKEA include a short amateurish DVD of how to assemble their furniture? Media is cheap, HD video cameras are cheap and Sweden is filled with attractive, young, long legged, tanned blondes…so why not hop to it IKEA and make life easier for your consumer? EDIT: After talking to Lachlan this morning he said to me “Oh, by the way nice post. I can’t believe you wrote DVD though. We should be telling IKEA to make better use of their youtube channel, if this is their real one? http://www.youtube.com/user/Ikea#g/a. After having a sniff around I found another IKEA channel on YouTube here: http://www.youtube.com/user/IKEAFAMILYLIVE and they have a Facebook Page here: http://www.facebook.com/IKEAUSA. Frankly, I’m disappointed with their online presence on social networking sites. So here’s an online strategy the sennza way!

The plan

YouTube – We would film DVD instructional videos for all the furniture items with two hot Swedish blondes which would entertain and inform the blokes about how to assemble furniture. These would go viral on Facebook, Twitter and in emails as all men love to perve and share links of hotties with their mates. We’d also give the ladies two ripped Swedish dudes assembling the furniture as well to capture their attention. The chances of these videos going viral would be much lower than the hot Swedes because women are generally more subtle and reserved when it comes to that kind of stuff. Although Gen Y and Gen Net females are breaking through this generalisation. Facebook – We’d build you a custom FBML (Facebook Markup Language) page that would have a monthly special page with click through links to the product pages on the IKEA site. We’d also post new YouTube videos of the Swedes assembling new products on the Facebook wall to show people new products. In-store – After the hot Swedish chicks and ripped Swedish dudes have gone viral we’d make them embark on a tour of the IKEA stores for instore furniture assembly. Why? Because we all know how much women love IKEA and blokes hate going in the store. If we’ve got two hot chicks in-store to entertain the blokes, they’ll be happy to take their wives and girlfriends to IKEA and whilst they wander around shopping, the blokes can have a good perve and everyone is happy. Also, I know my gay mates all love IKEA already so they’d be even happier to perve on ripped dudes as well and they’d also go on a testosterone fueled spending spree afterwards. Have a think about that IKEA! sennza can sort you out online!
